elements.title: Kāneiolouma Complex (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ancient Hawaiian village known as the Kāneiolouma Complex (pictured) is across the street from a popular beach on the island of Kauaʻi?

elements.title: Shinhanchon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Vladivostok, the Korean enclave Shinhanchon served as a hub of the Korean independence movement?

elements.title: Mount Aniakchak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the crater lake produced by the 1628–1627 BCE eruption of Mount Aniakchak generated one of the largest floods of the last 10,000 years?

elements.title: Work for Curaçao (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Work for Curaçao candidate in the 2021 Curaçao general election received 427 votes despite being dead?

elements.title: Here I Go Again (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Legends of Tomorrow episode "Here I Go Again" contains multiple ABBA references?

elements.title: Weston Turville Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Weston Turville Castle was slighted on Henry II's orders after the Revolt of 1173–1174?

elements.title: one crypto-Jew (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when offered a chance to repent before being burnt at the stake, one crypto-Jew allegedly told his tormentors to "throw more wood on the fire"?

elements.title: Gerboise Verte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to witnesses, the plutonium charge in the bomb used in the nuclear weapons test Gerboise Verte was transported in an economy car?

elements.title: Ukrainian Sheriffs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ukrainian Sheriffs went to summer school after being shot?
